thread.title_full: At least 20 dead after suicide bomber strikes Afghanistan’s Supreme Court - National | Globalnews.ca

author: Rahim Faiez
title: At least 20 dead after suicide bomber strikes Afghanistan’s Supreme Court - National | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 7, 2017 10:29 am At least 20 dead after suicide bomber strikes Afghanistan’s Supreme Court By Rahim Faiez The Associated Press 
Afghan security officials stand guard outside the Afghan Supreme court building after a suicide bomb blast in Kabul, Afghanistan, 07 February 2017. EPA/HEDAYATULLAH AMID What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - Story continues below 
The attacker was on foot, and targeted a side door as court employees and other people were exiting the building in downtown Kabul, the Interior Ministry said. Public Health Minister Ferozuddin Feroz said 41 people were wounded, including 10 in critical condition. 
READ MORE: Barely half of Afghanistan is under government control: report 
No one immediately claimed the attack, which bore the hallmarks of the Taliban. The insurgents have been at war with the U.S.-backed government for 15 years and have increasingly targeted the judiciary since the execution of six convicted insurgents last May. 
Shortly after the executions, a suicide bomber targeted a minibus carrying court employees in Kabul during the morning rush hour, killing 11 people in an attack claimed by the Taliban, which called it an act of revenge. 
In June, three Taliban fighters stormed a court building in the eastern Logar province, killing seven people, including a newly appointed chief prosecutor, before being shot dead by police. Raw video: Aftermath of roadside bombing in Kabul, Afghanistan
